subtopic.sub_topic_name: Types of programming language, translators and IDEs

learning_objectives.description: Explain high-level vs. low-level languages, with advantages and disadvantages.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Covers readability, debugging ease, machine independence, hardware interaction.

learning_objectives.description: Understand that assembly language uses mnemonics and requires an assembler for translation.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Assembly language is a form of low-level language using mnemonics.

learning_objectives.description: Describe compiler and interpreter operation: how each translates high-level language and reports errors.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Compiler translates all code before execution, produces executable. Interpreter translates and executes line-by-line, stops at errors. Compiler gives error report for entire code; interpreter stops at first error.

learning_objectives.description: Explain the advantages and disadvantages of compilers and interpreters.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Interpreters are mainly for program development, compilers for translating final programs.

learning_objectives.description: Explain the role and functions of an IDE.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Functions include code editor, run-time environment, translators, error diagnostics, auto-completion, auto-correction, pretty print.
